body_html:
Same issue here. I have reproduced it in jupyter notebook:

# In[1]:
%%bash
python -m caffe2.python.models.download -i inception_v2

# In[2]:
predict_net_path = '/opt/caffe2/caffe2/python/models/inception_v2/predict_net.pb'
init_net_path = '/opt/caffe2/caffe2/python/models/inception_v2/init_net.pb'

# In[3]:
with open(init_net_path) as f:
    init_net = f.read()
with open(predict_net_path) as f:
    predict_net = f.read() 

# Out[3]:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
UnicodeDecodeError                        Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-d225d3cba4d7> in <module>()
      1 with open(init_net_path) as f:
----> 2     init_net = f.read()
      3 with open(predict_net_path) as f:
      4     predict_net = f.read()

/usr/lib/python3.5/codecs.py in decode(self, input, final)
    319         # decode input (taking the buffer into account)
    320         data = self.buffer + input
--> 321         (result, consumed) = self._buffer_decode(data, self.errors, final)
    322         # keep undecoded input until the next call
    323         self.buffer = data[consumed:]

UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0x80 in position 20: invalid start byte

body:
Same issue here. I have reproduced it in jupyter notebook:
```
# In[1]:
%%bash
python -m caffe2.python.models.download -i inception_v2

# In[2]:
predict_net_path = '/opt/caffe2/caffe2/python/models/inception_v2/predict_net.pb'
init_net_path = '/opt/caffe2/caffe2/python/models/inception_v2/init_net.pb'

# In[3]:
with open(init_net_path) as f:
    init_net = f.read()
with open(predict_net_path) as f:
    predict_net = f.read() 

# Out[3]:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
UnicodeDecodeError                        Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-d225d3cba4d7> in <module>()
      1 with open(init_net_path) as f:
----> 2     init_net = f.read()
      3 with open(predict_net_path) as f:
      4     predict_net = f.read()

/usr/lib/python3.5/codecs.py in decode(self, input, final)
    319         # decode input (taking the buffer into account)
    320         data = self.buffer + input
--> 321         (result, consumed) = self._buffer_decode(data, self.errors, final)
    322         # keep undecoded input until the next call
    323         self.buffer = data[consumed:]

UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0x80 in position 20: invalid start byte
```
